column4: hey everyone. i just upgraded to 11.04 but when i start it freezes part way through. if i select the grub option previous versions and choose the first item there ubuntu starts up as it should. any ideas?
hi , have you tried one of the boot parameter options.
which boot options am  i looking to change?

this is how i've done it , added ' nomodeset ' backspaced the 2 "--" and went back to grub hit 'e' looked for the line where there was two words , splash and the other i can't quite remember. finaly reboot. thats about it.
you could try any of them , all of them at once.
its strange because i can start with and old kernal, any idea how i can try to re-install the new kernel?
no idea yet , on how to in your situation , i whould go with the Boot parameters options method first.
all right ill give it a shot
hmm i had no luck but it will start up in safe graphics mode although the resolution is bad
Excuse me , i wen to grab my coffee , so have you tried all of them options.
yes i did to no avail... i reinstalled the kernel and im up and running, just a couple small issues to work through
in unity am i suppoes to be able to move the windows that are open? i cant seem to be able to resize or move them
